thread.title: New London's Dunn picked as Big East top player
thread.title_full: New London's Dunn picked as Big East top player

author: Gavin Keefe
title: New London's Dunn picked as Big East top player
text:
New London's Dunn picked as Big East top player Published October 14. 2015 10:11AM By Gavin Keefe 
New York -- Kris Dunn added to his impressive list of preseason honors on Wednesday. 
The Big East Conference named the former New London High School star and current Providence College guard its preseason player of the year. 
The news was announced during Big East basketball media day at Madison Square Garden. 
Dunn has received numerous preseason honors in recent weeks, including several All-American selections. 
He's coming off a superb sophomore season during which he averaged 15.6 points, 5.6 rebounds, 7.5 assists and 2.8 steals and led the Friars to an NCAA tournament appearance. He was the first guard in Big East history to earn the conference's player of the year and top defender awards in the same season. 
Dunn was a projected NBA first-round draft choice but elected to return for his junior season. Now he's poised to challenge for national player of the year honors.
